results.title: Zea
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Leduc, Andre Leduc, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A superb visual trick that will mystify its audience, this animated film transforms the commonplace into magic. The film presented a serious technical challenge because the subject was both elusive and explosive. A film to watch, enjoy and laugh about. Film without words.

results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 2
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, and people and places which care for our health. This program looks at the dentis and doctor, hospitals and operations, ears and eyes, safety and environmental health and feelings. Finally, Zardip is able to attain the healthy wellness he had been seeking.

results.title: Z00 = A Zed and Two Noughts
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Peter Sainsbury and Artificial Eye
results.brief_description: A bizarre meditation on the processes of life, death and decay, by that stylist of the off-beat and the grotesque, Peter Greenaway. Starring Joss Ackland, Brian Deacon, Eric Deacon, and Andrea Ferreol. “Very funny…very bizarre…beautiful, clever, dazzling.”

results.title: Yudie
results.creator_credit: Mirra Bank and New Day Films
results.brief_description: An old Jewish lady talks about her life on the East Side of New York City particularly recalling the strong sense of community and the concern felt by old migrants for newer ones.

results.title: Youth and music
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The National Gallery of Canada serves the Canadian public in many ways. This film tours the galleries in Ottawa where the national collection of old masters, as well as modern works, are on display. It shows how the Gallery helps foster art appreciation. Behind the scenes we see another phase of the work of art—the cleaning, preservation and storing of art treasures.

results.title: The Towering inferno
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, Irwin Allen, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A skyscraper and am all-star cast go up in flames in this classic 70s disaster movie. To celebrate the construction of the Glass Tower, the world’s tallest building, architect Doug Roberts and builder James Duncan hold a gala event on the highest floors. The trouble is that Duncan’s son-in-law and electrical subcontractor, Roger Simmons, installed faulty wiring throughout the 138-story tower to save money. While the town VIPs enjoy the party, a security guard wonders why his equipment is malfunctioning, only to discover that a burnt-out circuit breaker has ignited some rubbish on the 85th floor, which is swiftly turning the skyscraper into a “towering inferno”. It is then up to Roberts and Fire Chief O’Hallorhan to find a way to stop the blaze. Cast includes Steve McQueen, Paul Newman, William Holden, Faye Dunaway, Fred Astaire, Richard Chamberlain, Jennifer Jones, O.J. Simpson, Robert Vaughn, Robert Wagner and more…

results.title: The Touch
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman’s first English language film continues his investigation of the human psyche and contemporary existential anguish and alienation. Elliott Gould is an American archaeologist visting Sweden who is welcomed into the house of Andreas and Karin (Max Von Sydow and Bibi Andersson). The American falls in love with Karin and the ensuing relationship forces her to examine her beliefs regarding marriage, family and status. However, as her affair continues she is forced to re-evaluate what it is that has drawn her to the American. Their relationship is frustrated by the insecurities and silences of people unable to find ways of communicating desire and truth. As in all his films, Bergman’s “The Touch” is part of an imtimate cinematic exploration: intense, controversial and painfully honest. Bergman’s remarkable ouvre is one of cinema’s most outstanding pleasures and the cinematography is by his longtime collaborator, Sven Nykvist.

results.title: At sea
results.brief_description: A baby boy dies on the journey from Los Angeles to Australia and is buried at sea. Many years later his mother still grieves for him, painfully and bitterly. Penny Fowler Smith uses highly evocative and sometimes abstract imagery to visual the mother’s emotional narration. At Sea is a cinematic reflection on loss.
